meanings.sent1: I bought a new pair of dockers for the party.
meanings.sent2: She loves wearing dockers because they are comfortable.
meanings.sent3: The dockers I bought were so stylish, they made me the talk of the town.
meanings.sent4: Her wardrobe was a sea of dockers, each pair representing a different occasion.
meanings.sent5: The dockers were like a second skin, fitting perfectly and making me feel confident.

meanings.definition: A person who works at a dock.
meanings.sent1: The dockers were unloading the cargo from the ship.
meanings.sent2: My uncle is a docker and he has many stories about life at the port.
meanings.sent3: The dockers were joking around, making the workday more enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: She watched the dockers with admiration, impressed by their strength and efficiency.
meanings.sent5: The dockers worked tirelessly under the scorching sun, their dedication unwavering.

meanings.definition: A type of software used to manage containers.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to implement dockers for better container management.
meanings.sent2: Learning how to use dockers was essential for the IT team.
meanings.sent3: The dockers software made container management a breeze, saving time and effort.
meanings.sent4: He compared different software options and found dockers to be the most efficient.
meanings.sent5: With dockers, the process of containerization became streamlined and organized.
